author: Vikas Vasudeva
text:
The Associated Chambers of Commerce and Industry of India (Assocham) has said the oviolent agitation in Haryana has already caused an estimated loss of Rs. 18,000-Rs. 20,000 crore in damage to public and private property and halting trade, industry, small business and transport.

One person was killed on Sunday in police firing and the death toll has now reached 11, Additional Chief Secretary (Home) P.K. Das told The Hindu here.

Mr. Das said the law and order situation in Rohtak, Gohana and Jind was better on Saturday night compared with Friday night.

“The government is studying the footprints of those who indulged in spreading hatred through social media,” he said.

Road and rail traffic through Haryana to North India from Delhi remained disrupted with bus and train services remaining suspended. Shops and commercial establishments also remained shut in the wake of the violent protests.

Haryana DGP Yashpal Singhal said: “Forces are trying to identify those indulging in violence and 45 persons have been rounded up.”

As many as 191 cases have been registered, said the Haryana DGP, adding he was confident that the situation would ease swiftly. “No casualties have occurred since Saturday evening,” he added.
title: Assocham pegs loss at Rs. 20,000 crore
